original: Milindapañha
analyzed: milindapañha
translated: The Questions of King Milinda

original: Anumānapañha
analyzed: anumāna pañha
translated: The Questions of King Milinda🔽The Chapter of Inference

original: Vessantaravagga
analyzed: vessantara vagga
translated: The Chapter of Vessantara

original: 10. Nibbānarūpasaṇṭhānapañha
translated: The Chapter on the Form and Shape of Nibbāna

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘nibbānaṁ nibbānan’ti yaṁ vadesi, sakkā pana tassa nibbānassa rūpaṁ
analyzed: bhante nāgasena nibbānam nibbānanti yam vadesi sakkā pana tassa nibbānassa
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that nibbāna is nibbāna, can the form,

original: vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitun”ti?
analyzed: vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti
translated: the shape, the size, the measure, the simile, the cause, the reason, the method of nibbāna be pointed out?”

original: “Appaṭibhāgaṁ, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ, na sakkā nibbānassa rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitun”ti.🔽“Etampāhaṁ, bhante nāgasena, na sampaṭicchāmi, yaṁ atthidhammassa nibbānassa rūpaṁ
analyzed: appaṭibhāga mahā rāja nibbāna na sakkā nibbānassa rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti  etam pāha bhante nāgasena na sampaṭicchāmi yam atthi dhammassa nibbānassa
translated: “Nibbāna is not a counterpart, sire, and it is not possible to point out the form, the shape, the size, the measure, the simile, the cause, the reason, the method of nibbāna.”

original: vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā apaññāpanaṁ,
analyzed: vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā apaññāpana
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, I do not agree that the form, the shape, the size, the measure, the simile, the cause, the reason, the method of nibbāna, which is a real existent thing, cannot be pointed out.

original: kāraṇena maṁ saññāpehī”ti.
analyzed: kāraṇena mama saññāpehi iti
translated: Convince me by reason.”

original: “Hotu, mahārāja, kāraṇena taṁ saññāpessāmi.
analyzed: hotu mahā rāja kāraṇena tam saññāpessāmi
translated: “Let it be, sire, I will convince you by reason.

original: Atthi, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo nāmā”ti?
analyzed: atthi mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ nāma ati
translated: Is there, sire, what is called the great ocean?”

original: “Āma, bhante, attheso mahāsamuddo”ti.
analyzed: āma bhante attha iso mahā samuddaḥ ti
translated: “Yes, venerable sir, the great ocean exists.”

original: “Sace taṁ, mahārāja, koci evaṁ puccheyya ‘kittakaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamudde udakaṁ,
analyzed: sace mahā rāja koci evam puccheyya kittaka mahā rāja mahā samudde udaka
translated: “If anyone should ask you, sire, ‘How much water is there in the great ocean,

original: kati pana te sattā, ye mahāsamudde paṭivasantī’ti, evaṁ puṭṭho tvaṁ, mahārāja, kinti🔽tassa byākareyyāsī”ti?
analyzed: kati pana te sattāḥ ye mahā samudde paṭivasanti iti evam mahā rāja kinti  tassa byākareyyāsi iti
translated: and how many beings live there in the great ocean?’ being asked thus, what would you say to him?”

original: “Sace maṁ, bhante, koci evaṁ puccheyya ‘kittakaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamudde udakaṁ, kati
analyzed: sace ma bhante koci evam puccheyya kittaka mahā rāja mahā samudde udaka kati
translated: “If anyone should ask me, venerable sir, ‘How much water is there in the great ocean,

original: pana te sattā, ye mahāsamudde paṭivasantī’ti, tamahaṁ, bhante, evaṁ vadeyyaṁ ‘apucchitabbaṁ
analyzed: pana te sattāḥ ye mahā samudde paṭivasanti iti tam aha bhante evam vadeyyam a pucchitabba
translated: and how many beings live there in the great ocean? ‘ being asked thus, venerable sir, I would say this to him: ‘You ask, good man, what cannot be asked.

original: maṁ tvaṁ, ambho purisa, pucchasi, nesā pucchā kenaci pucchitabbā, ṭhapanīyo eso pañho.
analyzed: mam tva ambho purisa pucchasi na isā pucchā kenacid pucchitabbā ṭhapanīyaḥ eso pañho
translated: This question should not be asked by anyone. This question is to be set aside.

original: Avibhatto lokakkhāyikehi mahāsamuddo, na sakkā mahāsamudde udakaṁ pariminituṁ sattā vā ye tattha vāsamupagatāti evāhaṁ, bhante tassa paṭivacanaṁ dadeyyan’”ti.
analyzed: a vibhattaḥ lokakkhāyikehi mahā samuddaḥ na sakkā mahā samudde udakam pariminitum sattāḥ vā ye tattha vāsam upagatāḥ ati eva āha bhante tassa paṭivacanam dadeyyanti
translated: The great ocean has not been fathomed by those who would measure it. It is not possible to measure the water in the great ocean or to count the beings that live there in the great ocean.’ Venerable sir, I would give this answer to that question.”

original: “Kissa pana tvaṁ, mahārāja, atthidhamme mahāsamudde evaṁ paṭivacanaṁ dadeyyāsi, nanu
analyzed: kissa pana tva mahā rāja atthi dhamme mahā samudde evam paṭivacanam dadeyyāsi nanu
translated: “But why, sire, should you give such an answer about the ocean, which is a thing that exists?

original: vigaṇetvā tassa ācikkhitabbaṁ ‘ettakaṁ mahāsamudde udakaṁ, ettakā ca sattā mahāsamudde paṭivasantī’”ti?
analyzed: vigaṇetvā tassa ācikkhitabbaṃ ettakam mahā samudde udake ettakā ca sattā mahā samudde paṭivasanti iti
translated: Should you not rather have said: ‘So much water is there in the ocean and so many beings live there’? “

original: “Na sakkā, bhante, avisayo eso pañho”ti.🔽“Yathā, mahārāja, atthidhammeyeva mahāsamudde na sakkā udakaṁ parigaṇetuṁ sattā vā ye tattha vāsamupagatā;
analyzed: na sakkā bhante avisayaḥ eso pañho ti  yathā mahā rāja mahā samudde na sakkā udakam parigaṇetum sattāḥ vā ye tattha vāsam upagatā
translated: “No, revered sir, that is not possible.”

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, atthidhammasseva nibbānassa na sakkā rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja atthi dhammassa iva nibbānassa na sakkā rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā
translated: “Just as, sire, it is not possible to count the water in the ocean or the beings that live there, so, sire, it is not possible to point out the form, the shape, the

original: vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayituṁ, vigaṇeyya,🔽mahārāja, iddhimā cetovasippatto mahāsamudde udakaṁ tatrāsaye ca satte, na tveva
analyzed: vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitu vigaṇeyya  mahā rājaḥ iddhimā mahā samudde udakam ca satte na tu eva
translated: age, the size, the simile, the cause, the reason, the method of the Nibbāna that exists.🔽You might, sire, count the water in the ocean and the beings that live there, if you were a possessor of supernormal power, having psychic control,

original: so iddhimā cetovasippatto sakkuṇeyya nibbānassa rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ
analyzed: saḥ iddhimā cetaḥ vasi pattaḥ sakkuṇeyya nibbānassa rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā
translated: but that possessor of supernormal power, having psychic control, would not be able to point out the form, the shape, the age, the size, the simile, the cause, the reason, the method of Nibbāna.

original: vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayituṁ.
analyzed: vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitu
translated: or by simile, or by cause, or by reason, or by method.”

original: Aparampi, mahārāja, uttariṁ kāraṇaṁ suṇohi, atthidhammasseva nibbānassa na sakkā
analyzed: aparam pi mahā rāja uttarim kāraṇam suṇohi atthi dhammassa iva nibbānassa na sakkā
translated: “Listen further, sire, to another reason why it is not possible to point out Nibbāna, which is a real existent,

original: rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti.🔽Atthi, mahārāja, devesu arūpakāyikā nāma devā”ti.
analyzed: rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti  atthi mahā rāja devesu arūpa kāyikā nāma deva ati
translated: by colour or shape or age or size or by simile or by cause or by reason or by method.”🔽“Sire, are there not gods among the devas who are formless?”

original: “Āma, bhante, suyyati ‘atthi devesu arūpakāyikā nāma devā’”ti.
analyzed: āma bhante suyyati atthi devesu arūpakāyikā nāma deva ati
translated: “Yes, revered sir, it is heard that there are gods among the devas who are formless.”

original: “Sakkā pana, mahārāja, tesaṁ arūpakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitun”ti?
analyzed: sakkā pana mahā rāja tesam arūpa kāyikānam devānam rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti
translated: “But, sire, is it possible to point out the colour or shape or age or size of those formless gods by simile or by cause or by reason or by method?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti
translated: “No, revered sir.”

original: “Tena hi, mahārāja, natthi arūpakāyikā devā”ti?
analyzed: tena hi mahā rāja natthi arūpa kāyikā deva ati
translated: “Then, sire, are there no formless gods?”

original: “Atthi, bhante, arūpakāyikā devā, na ca sakkā tesaṁ rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitun”ti.
analyzed: atthi bhante arūpa kāyikāḥ devāḥ na ca sakkā tesam rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti
translated: “There are, revered sir, gods of the formless world, but it is not possible to point out their form or shape or size or extent by any simile or reason or cause or method.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, atthisattānaṁyeva arūpakāyikānaṁ devānaṁ na sakkā rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayituṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja atthi sattā anayā iva arūpa kāyikānam devānam na sakkā rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitu
translated: “As, sire, it is not possible to point out the form or shape or size or extent of the formless gods who have a being but not a material body,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, atthidhammasseva nibbānassa na sakkā rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitun”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja atthi dhammassa iva nibbānassa na sakkā rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitunti
translated: even so, sire, it is not possible to point out the form or shape or size or extent of Nibbāna which is a state of being.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, hotu ekantasukhaṁ nibbānaṁ, na ca sakkā tassa rūpaṁ vā saṇṭhānaṁ vā vayaṁ vā pamāṇaṁ vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayituṁ.
analyzed: bhante nāgasena hotu ekanta sukham nibbāna na ca sakkā tassa rūpam vā saṇṭhānam vā vayam vā pamāṇam vā opammena vā kāraṇena vā hetunā vā nayena vā upadassayitu
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, let Nibbāna be all happiness, but it is not possible to point out its form or shape or size or extent by any simile or reason or cause or method.

original: Atthi pana, bhante, nibbānassa guṇaṁ aññehi anupaviṭṭhaṁ kiñci opammanidassanamattan”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana bhante nibbānassa guṇam aññehi an upaviṭṭham kiñci opamma nidassana mattam ti
translated: “But, revered sir, is there any simile that can be given for the special qualities of Nibbāna that are not shared by anything else?”

original: “Sarūpato, mahārāja, natthi, guṇato pana sakkā kiñci opammanidassanamattaṁ upadassayitun”ti.
analyzed: sarūpataḥ mahā rāja natthi guṇataḥ pana sakkā kiñci opamma nidassana mattam upadassayitun ti
translated: “There is not, sire, in the literal sense, but a simile can be given for the special qualities.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, yathāhaṁ labhāmi nibbānassa guṇatopi ekadesaparidīpanamattaṁ, tathā sīghaṁ brūhi, nibbāpehi me hadayapariḷāhaṁ vinaya sītalamadhuravacanamālutenā”ti.🔽“Padumassa, mahārāja, eko guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho, udakassa dve guṇā, agadassa
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena yathā aham labhāmi nibbānassa guṇataḥ pi tathā sīgham brūhi nibbāpehi me hadaya pariḷāham vinaya sītala madhura vacana mālutena ati  padumassa mahā rāja ekaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ udakassa dve guṇāḥ agadassa
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena. Speak quickly so that I may get some idea of the special qualities of Nibbāna and so that you may cool the fever of my heart with the cool sweet words of your reply.”

original: tayo guṇā, mahāsamuddassa cattāro guṇā, bhojanassa pañca guṇā, ākāsassa dasa guṇā,🔽maṇiratanassa tayo guṇā, lohitacandanassa tayo guṇā, sappimaṇḍassa tayo guṇā, girisikharassa
analyzed: tayaḥ guṇā mahā samuddassa cattāro guṇā bhojanassa pañca guṇāḥ ākāsassa dasa guṇā  maṇi ratanassa tayaḥ guṇā lohitacandanassa tayaḥ guṇā sappimaṇḍassa tayaḥ guṇā giri sikharassa
translated: “Sire, one quality of the lotus is shared by Nibbāna, two qualities of water, three qualities of the antidote, four qualities of the great ocean, five qualities of food, ten qualities of space,

original: pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: three qualities of the jewel treasure, three qualities of red sandalwood, three qualities of clarified butter, five qualities of the mountain peak are shared by Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘padumassa eko guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamo padumassa eko guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena padumassa ekaḥ guṇo nibbānam anupaviṭṭho ti yam vadesi katamaḥ padumassa ekaḥ guṇo nibbānam anupaviṭṭho ti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say one quality of the lotus is present in Nibbāna, which is that one quality of the lotus that is present in Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, padumaṁ anupalittaṁ udakena;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja padumam an upalittam udakena
translated: “As, sire, the lotus is unstained by water,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sabbakilesehi anupalittaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sabba kilesehi anupalitta
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is unstained by all defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, padumassa eko guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho”ti.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja padumassa ekaḥ guṇo nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: This, sire, is the one quality of the lotus that is present in Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘udakassa dve guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame udakassa dve guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena udakassa dve guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame udakassa dve guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say two qualities of water are present in Nibbāna, which are those two qualities of water that are present in Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, udakaṁ sītalaṁ pariḷāhanibbāpanaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja udakam sītalam pariḷāha nibbāpana
translated: “As, sire, water is cool and puts out the heat of fever,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sītalaṁ sabbakilesapariḷāhanibbāpanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sītalam sabba kilesa pariḷāha nibbāpana
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is cool and puts out the heat of all defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, udakassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja udakassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of water that is present in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, udakaṁ kilantatasitapipāsitaghammābhitattānaṁ janapasupajānaṁ pipāsāvinayanaṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja udakam kilantata sita pipāsita ghamma abhitattānam janapas upajānam
translated: Again, Your Majesty, water is a means of allaying the thirst of people who are exhausted, heated and thirsty by a journey through the country;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ kāmataṇhābhavataṇhāvibhavataṇhāpipāsāvinayanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam kāma taṇhā bhava taṇhā vibhava taṇhā pipāsā vinayana
translated: even so, Your Majesty, Nibbāna is a means of allaying the thirst of craving for sense pleasures, craving for existence and craving for non-existence.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, udakassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja udakassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, Your Majesty, is the second quality of water that is to be found in Nibbāna.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, udakassa dve guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja udakassa dve guṇā nibbānam
translated: These, Your Majesty, are the two qualities of water that are to be found in Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘agadassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame agadassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena agadassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame agadassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say three qualities of an antidote are to be found in Nibbāna, which are these three qualities of an antidote that are to be found in Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, agado visapīḷitānaṁ sattānaṁ paṭisaraṇaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja agadaḥ visa pīḍitānam sattānam
translated: “As, sire, an antidote is a refuge for beings afflicted by poison,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ kilesavisapīḷitānaṁ sattānaṁ paṭisaraṇaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam kilesa visapīḍitānam sattānam paṭisaraṇa
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is a refuge for beings afflicted by the poison of the defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, agadassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja agadassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of an antidote that is to be found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, agado rogānaṁ antakaro;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja agadaḥ
translated: Again, sire, an antidote is the end of diseases;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sabbadukkhānaṁ antakaraṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sabba dukkhānam anta kara
translated: Even so, sire, is Nibbāna the ender of all suffering.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, agadassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja agadassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of the antidote that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, agado amataṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja agadaḥ amata
translated: “Again, sire, the antidote is ambrosia;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ amataṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam amata
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna ambrosia.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, agadassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja agadassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of the antidote that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, agadassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja agadassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the three qualities of the antidote that are found in Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘mahāsamuddassa cattāro guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame mahāsamuddassa cattāro guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena mahā samuddassa cattāro guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame mahā samuddassa cattāro guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that four qualities of the great ocean are found in Nibbāna, which are these four qualities of the great ocean that are found in Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo suñño sabbakuṇapehi;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ suññaḥ sabba kuṇapehi
translated: “As, sire, the great ocean is void of all corpses;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ suññaṁ sabbakilesakuṇapehi.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam suññam sabba kilesa kuṇapehi
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna void of all corpses of defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja mahā samuddassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of the great ocean that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo mahanto anorapāro, na paripūrati sabbasavantīhi;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ mahantaḥ anorapāraḥ na paripūrati sabba savantīhi
translated: “Again, sire, the great ocean is vast and has no overflood, it is not filled with all the rivers flowing into it;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ mahantaṁ anorapāraṁ, na pūrati sabbasattehi.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam mahantam anorapāra na pūrati sabba sattehi
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is vast and has no overflood, it is not filled with all beings.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja mahā samuddassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of the great ocean that is reflected in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo mahantānaṁ bhūtānaṁ āvāso;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ mahantānam bhūtānam āvāsaḥ
translated: “Again, sire, the great ocean is the abode of great beings;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ mahantānaṁ arahantānaṁ vimalakhīṇāsavabalappattavasībhūtamahābhūtānaṁ āvāso.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam mahantānam arahantānam vimala khīṇa āsava bala patta vasībhūta mahābhūtānam āvāsaḥ
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is the abode of great arahats who are stainless, whose cankers are destroyed, who have attained strength, who have attained mastery, who are great beings.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja mahā samuddassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of the great ocean that is reflected in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo aparimitavividhavipulavīcipupphasaṅkusumito;🔽evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ aparimitavividhavipulaparisuddhavijjāvimuttipupphasaṅkusumitaṁ.
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ aparimita vividha vipula vīci puppha saṅkusumitaḥ 🔽evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam aparimita vividha vipula parisuddha vijjā vimutti puppha saṅkusumita
translated: “Again, sire, the great ocean is in full flower with an abundance of various kinds of lovely flowers;🔽even so, sire, Nibbāna is in full flower with an abundance of various kinds of lovely flowers of knowledge and freedom that are quite pure.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, mahāsamuddassa catuttho guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja mahā samuddassa catutthaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, O king, is the ocean’s fourth quality that it possesses in common with Nibbāna.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, mahāsamuddassa cattāro guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja mahā samuddassa cattāro guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: This, sire, is the ocean’s fourth quality that is like a quality of Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘bhojanassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame bhojanassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhojanassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame bhojanassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that five qualities of food are like qualities of Nibbāna, which are these five qualities of food that are like qualities of Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, bhojanaṁ sabbasattānaṁ āyudhāraṇaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja bhojanam sabba sattānam āyudha araṇa
translated: “As, sire, food is the support of life for all beings,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sacchikataṁ jarāmaraṇanāsanato āyudhāraṇaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sacchikatam jarā maraṇanā asanataḥ āyudha araṇa
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna, when realized, is the support of life because it destroys old age and death.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja bhojanassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of food that is like a quality of Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanaṁ sabbasattānaṁ balavaḍḍhanaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja bhojanam sabba sattānam bala vaḍḍhana
translated: “And again, sire, food increases the strength of all beings;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sacchikataṁ sabbasattānaṁ iddhibalavaḍḍhanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sacchikatam sabba sattānam iddhi bala vaḍḍhana
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna, when realized, increases the strength of all beings in the power of success.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja bhojanassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of food that is like a quality of Nibbāna.”

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanaṁ sabbasattānaṁ vaṇṇajananaṁ;🔽evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sacchikataṁ sabbasattānaṁ guṇavaṇṇajananaṁ.
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja bhojanam sabba sattānam vaṇṇa janana  evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sacchikatam sabba sattānam guṇa vaṇṇa janana
translated: “Again, sire, food produces beauty in all beings;🔽even so, sire, Nibbāna, when realized, produces the beauty of virtue in all beings.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja bhojanassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of food that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanaṁ sabbasattānaṁ darathavūpasamanaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja bhojanam sabba sattānam daratha vūpasamana
translated: “Again, sire, food allays the hunger of all beings;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sacchikataṁ sabbasattānaṁ sabbakilesadarathavūpasamanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sacchikatam sabba sattānam sabba kilesa da ratha vūpasamana
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna, when realized, allays the hunger of all beings with the hunger of all defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanassa catuttho guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja bhojanassa catutthaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of food that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanaṁ sabbasattānaṁ jighacchādubbalyapaṭivinodanaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja bhojanam sabba sattānam jighacchā dubbalya paṭivinodana
translated: “Again, sire, food allays the weakness of hunger in all beings;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sacchikataṁ sabbasattānaṁ sabbadukkhajighacchādubbalyapaṭivinodanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sacchikatam sabba sattānam sabba dukkha jighacchā dubbalya paṭivinodana
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna, when realized, allays the weakness of hunger with the hunger of all suffering in all beings.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, bhojanassa pañcamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja bhojanassa pañcamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the fifth quality of food that is found in Nibbāna.”

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, bhojanassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja bhojanassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the five qualities of food that are in conformity with Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘ākāsassa dasa guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame ākāsassa dasa guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena ākāsassa dasa guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame ākāsassa dasa guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that ten qualities of space are in conformity with Nibbāna, which are these ten qualities of space that are in conformity with Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, ākāso na jāyati, na jīyati, na mīyati, na cavati, na uppajjati, duppasaho, acorāharaṇo, anissito, vihagagamano, nirāvaraṇo, ananto.
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja ākāsaḥ na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na uppajjati duppasahaḥ a cora āharaṇaḥ a nissitaḥ vihaga gamanaḥ nirāvaraṇaḥ anantaḥ
translated: “As, sire, space is not born, does not age, does not die, does not pass away, does not reappear, is hard to overcome, is not carried off by thieves, is not dependent, is the way of the birds, is free from obstruction, is infinite,

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ na jāyati, na jīyati, na mīyati, na cavati, na uppajjati, duppasahaṁ, acorāharaṇaṁ, anissitaṁ, ariyagamanaṁ, nirāvaraṇaṁ, anantaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam na jāyati na jīyati na mīyati na cavati na uppajjati duppasaha a cora āharaṇa a nissita ariya gamana nirāvaraṇa ananta
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is not born, does not age, does not die, does not pass away, does not reappear, is hard to overcome, is not carried off by thieves, is not dependent, is the way of the noble ones, is free from obstruction, is infinite.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, ākāsassa dasa guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja ākāsassa dasa guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the ten qualities of space that are in conformity with Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘maṇiratanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame maṇiratanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena maṇi ratanassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame maṇi ratanassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say three qualities of the jewel are to be found in Nibbāna, which are these three qualities of the jewel that are to be found in Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, maṇiratanaṁ kāmadadaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja maṇi ratanam kām adada
translated: “As, sire, the jewel gives what is desired,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ kāmadadaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam kām adada
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna gives what is desired.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, maṇiratanassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja maṇi ratanassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of the jewel that is to be found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, maṇiratanaṁ hāsakaraṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja maṇi ratanam hāsa kara
translated: “And again, sire, the jewel causes laughter;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ hāsakaraṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam hāsa kara
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna causes laughter.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, maṇiratanassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja maṇi ratanassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of the jewel that is to be found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, maṇiratanaṁ ujjotattakaraṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja maṇi ratanam
translated: “And again, sire, the jewel causes brightness;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ ujjotattakaraṁ.🔽Ayaṁ, mahārāja, maṇiratanassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam ujjotattakara  aya mahā rāja maṇi ratanassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna causes brightness.🔽This, sire, is the third quality of the jewel that is to be found in Nibbāna.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, maṇiratanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja maṇi ratanassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the three qualities of the jewel that are to be found in Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘lohitacandanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame lohitacandanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena lohitacandanassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame lohitacandanassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say three qualities of red sandalwood are similar to Nibbāna, which are these three qualities of red sandalwood that are similar to Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, lohitacandanaṁ dullabhaṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja lohitacandanam dullabha
translated: “As, sire, red sandalwood is hard to obtain,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ dullabhaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam dullabha
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna hard to obtain.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, lohitacandanassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja lohitacandanassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of red sandalwood that is similar to Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, lohitacandanaṁ asamasugandhaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja lohitacandanam asama sugandha
translated: “And again, sire, red sandalwood has an unequalled sweet scent;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ asamasugandhaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam asamasugandha
translated: even so, sire, does Nibbāna have an unequalled sweet scent.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, lohitacandanassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja lohitacandanassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of red sandalwood that is similar to Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, lohitacandanaṁ sajjanapasatthaṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja lohitacandanam
translated: “And again, sire, red sandalwood is praised by the good;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ ariyasajjanapasatthaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam ariya sajjana pasattha
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna praised by the good.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, lohitacandanassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja lohitacandanassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of red sandalwood that is similar to Nibbāna.”🔽“Revered Nāgasena, when you say three qualities of the moon are similar to Nibbāna, which are these three qualities of the moon that are similar to Nibbāna?”

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, lohitacandanassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja lohitacandanassa tayo guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the three qualities of red sandalwood that are in conformity with Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘sappimaṇḍassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame sappimaṇḍassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena sappi maṇḍassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame sappi maṇḍassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say three qualities of clarified butter are in conformity with Nibbāna, which are these three qualities of clarified butter that are in conformity with Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍo vaṇṇasampanno;🔽evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ guṇavaṇṇasampannaṁ.
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja sappimaṇḍaḥ vaṇṇa sampannaḥ  evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam guṇa vaṇṇa sampanna
translated: “As, sire, clarified butter is endowed with colour,🔽even so, sire, is Nibbāna endowed with the colour of virtue.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja sappimaṇḍassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of clarified butter that is in conformity with Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍo gandhasampanno;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sappimaṇḍaḥ gandha sampannaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, clarified butter is endowed with smell;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sīlagandhasampannaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sīla gandha sampanna
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna endowed with the smell of morality.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja sappimaṇḍassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of clarified butter that is in conformity with Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍo rasasampanno;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sappimaṇḍaḥ rasa sampannaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, clarified butter is endowed with taste;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ rasasampannaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam rasa sampanna
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna endowed with taste.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja sappimaṇḍassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of clarified butter that is in conformity with Nibbāna.”

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, sappimaṇḍassa tayo guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja sappimaṇḍassa tayaḥ guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the three qualities of the clarified butter that correspond to Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘girisikharassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā’ti yaṁ vadesi, katame girisikharassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena giri sikharassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti yam vadesi katame giri sikharassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhāti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say five qualities of the mountain peak correspond to Nibbāna, which are these five qualities of the mountain peak that correspond to Nibbāna?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, girisikharaṁ accuggataṁ;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja giri sikharam accuggata
translated: “As, sire, the mountain peak is lofty,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ accuggataṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam accuggata
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna lofty.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharassa paṭhamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja giri sikharassa paṭhamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the first quality of the mountain peak that corresponds to Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharaṁ acalaṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja giri sikharam acala
translated: “And again, sire, the mountain peak is unshaken,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ acalaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam acala
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna unshaken.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharassa dutiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja giri sikharassa dutiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of the mountain peak that corresponds to Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharaṁ duradhirohaṁ;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja giri sikharam duradhiroha
translated: “And again, sire, the mountain peak is difficult to climb,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ duradhirohaṁ sabbakilesānaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam duradhiroham sabba kilesāna
translated: even so, sire, is Nibbāna difficult to climb for all the defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharassa tatiyo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja giri sikharassa tatiyaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of the mountain peak that corresponds to Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharaṁ sabbabījānaṁ avirūhanaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja giri sikharam sabba bījānam a virūhana
translated: Again, sire, the mountain-peak is the non-growing place for all seeds;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ sabbakilesānaṁ avirūhanaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam sabba kilesānam a virūhana
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is the non-growing place for all defilements.

original: Ayaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharassa catuttho guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: aya mahā rāja giri sikharassa catutthaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of the mountain-peak that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharaṁ anunayappaṭighavippamuttaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja giri sikharam anunaya ppaṭigha vippamutta
translated: Again, sire, the mountain-peak is free from affection and aversion;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, nibbānaṁ anunayappaṭighavippamuttaṁ.🔽Ayaṁ, mahārāja, girisikharassa pañcamo guṇo nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭho.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja nibbānam anunaya ppaṭigha vippamutta  aya mahā rāja giri sikharassa pañcamaḥ guṇaḥ nibbānam anupaviṭṭhaḥ
translated: even so, sire, Nibbāna is free from affection and aversion.🔽This, sire, is the fifth quality of the mountain-peak that is found in Nibbāna.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, girisikharassa pañca guṇā nibbānaṁ anupaviṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja giri sikharassa pañca guṇāḥ nibbānam
translated: These, sire, are the five qualities of the mountain-peak that are found in Nibbāna.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “Excellent, revered Nāgasena; so it is, therefore do I accept this speech.”

original: Nibbānarūpasaṇṭhānapañho dasamo.
analyzed: nibbāna rūpa saṇṭhāna pañhaḥ dasamaḥ
translated: The tenth chapter.
